recipes.name: Shami Kebab
ingredients: Split gram lentils washed and soaked 2 tbsp
A handful of chopped coriander and mint
instructions: In a bowl, take Meat and mix it well with Garam masala Powder, Garlic Ginger paste, Red Chilli Powder, Salt, Egg, and chopped Green Chilli.
Make cylindrical shapes of the mixed meat.
In a frying pan, take such amount of Oil so that half of the Seekh Kebabs get dipped in it.
Heat the Oil and fry till golden brown and place them in a separate plate.
For curry: In saucepan add Oil, Cinnamon, Cloves, Tomatoes and stir fry.
Now add, Red Chilli, Garam Masala Powder, Garlic Ginger Paste, Tomato Puree, and let it cook for a while.
When the gravy is completely cooked, add Yoghurt and little of Water.
Spread the Seekh Kebabs on the gravy, cover the lid and simmer on light.
Delicious Kashmiri Kebab Curry is ready.

recipes.name: Mughlaee Chicken Boti
ingredients: Boneless chicken (cut into small cubes) 1/2 kg
Fresh coriander and mint, chopped 3 1/2 tbsp
instructions: In a bowl mix all the spices and make a thick paste.
Marinate chicken overnight in the refrigerator.
Grease a baking tray with butter or oil, spread marinated chicken cubes on it and bake in a preheated oven at 180 C for 10-15 minutes till chicken becomes crispy and tender.
Turn the chicken over halfway through baking.
Garnish with finely chopped coriander and mint leaves.
Serve hot with parathas or rice.

recipes.name: Beef Malai Tikka
instructions: Cut away and discard heavy fat on meat, if any.
Cut meat into 1 inch cubes.
Place meat in bowl with ginger, garlic, green chilli, cream and salt, mix well.
Cover and marinate for at least overnight.
Just before eating, pour enough oil in kadhai, wok, or deep frying pan to a depth of 2 inches.
Set on medium heat (medium low flame).
Put egg into shallow dish and beat lightly.
Dip meat cubes in egg and then in bread crumbs.
Cover generously with bread crumbs until encrusted.
When oil is heated, put as many meat cubes in heated oil that will cover the bottom of the container with 1 layer.
Stir and fry until golden brown or the meat is done to your taste.

recipes.name: Paneer Cutlets (Version 2)
instructions: Combine grated cottage cheese and all other ingredients, adding gram flour in the end, and mix together in a bowl to make a smooth paste.
Shape the mixture into round cutlets.
Heat oil in a wok till it starts smoking.
Slide a few cutlets at a time into the oil and fry till they are golden brown and crisp on all sides.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Paneer Tikka
instructions: Wash and cut the paneer into small cubes.
Mix the caraway seeds, white pepper powder, Garam masala, turmeric powder, two thirds of the lemon juice and salt.
Sprinkle over the paneer cubes.
Keep aside for 1 hour in the refrigerator.
Mix cream, yoghurt and gram flour/ cornflour in a bowl.
Add remaining ingredients and whisk well to make a fine batter.
Add the paneer cubes to this and marinate for at least 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to (150-175 degree c/ 300-350 degree F).
Thread the paneer cubes onto the skewers, 2 cm apart.
Roast in an oven/tandoor/charcoal grill for 5-6 minutes.
Baste with melted butter.
Sprinkle with chaat masala and the remaining lemon juice.
Serve with a green salad.

recipes.name: Bajra and Beef Kebabs
ingredients: Fresh coriander leaves, finely chopped 1 bunch
instructions: Add all ingredients to the beef except tomatoes, increase or decrease quantity of bajra flour (should bind well).
Leave to marinate for 2-3 hours. Knead well.
Add tomatoes just before frying.
Heat oil, take about 1 tsp of the marinated beef and drop gently into oil and fry.
Do not turn the kababs immediately, as they will break.
Lower heat to medium and turn over once.
Remove and place on paper to drain extra oil. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Tangdi Kebab
instructions: Clean and trim excess fat and skin from the drumsticks.
Dry them with a clean and absorbent kitchen towel.
Make three to four long deep incisions.
Apply lemon juice and keep aside.
Peel ginger and garlic, wash and grind them to a paste.
Wash green chillies, remove stem and then chop them fine.
Hang skimmed milk yogurt for fifteen to twenty minutes to drain off excess water.
Roast gram flour in a non-stick pan on a low heat, stirring continuously.
Cool and mix with hung yogurt, ginger and garlic paste, turmeric powder, Garam masala powder, red chilli powder, salt and chopped green chillies.
Marinate chicken drumsticks in above mixture and refrigerate for one to two hours.
Skewer marinated chicken drumsticks and roast in a moderately hot charcoal fired tandoor or alternately cook in pre-heated oven at 220 degrees Celsius for five minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 180 degrees & further cook for 20 minutes or till completely cooked.
Turn drumsticks couple of times to ensure even cooking and colour.
Serve hot, sprinkled with chaat masala and lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Hara Kebab (Version 2)
instructions: Peel the bananas and the potatoes, and cut them into medium sized cubes.
Heat the oil and add the cumin seeds.
Stir for one minute and then add the vegetables.
Lower the flame and add the salt and turmeric powder, Garlic, Ginger, Green chilli and Juice of limes mix.
Add 1/2 a cup of water and cover with a lid and cook till the bananas and potatoes are tender.
Add the black pepper, coriander leaves, mint leaves and mix well.

recipes.name: Yam Kebabs
instructions: Peel and wash the yam.
Immerse in boiling water and cook until it becomes tender.
Remove from water, grate finely and squeeze out all the excess water.
Add the remaining ingredients to the grated yam.
Mix well and divide into 8 equal portions.
Shape the portions into medallions.
Shallow fry on medium heat till they become crisp and golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Tuna Fish Cutlet
instructions: Heat the oil in pan.
Add onion, ginger, garlic & green chillies til their fresh smell goes or till they are little cooked.
Add fish to it & mix well.
Remember not to add water to it.
We have to make this mixture dry.
As the fish is cooked, we just have to cook it till all the water is evaporated.
Add mashed potatoes & mix well.
Add pepper powder & garam masala.
Mix well and add coriander leaves.
Allow it to cool. Make small flat round shape balls.
Beat the eggs in a bowl and take bread crumbs in another plate.
Dip the balls in the egg mixture & then roll them on the bread crumbs.
Fry the cutlets deep in oil.

recipes.name: Gular Kebab
instructions: Boil mince with gram lentils, water, Crushed red chilli, white cumin seeds, ginger garlic paste, chopped onion, salt, Garam masala and grind finely.
Mix in it 1 egg and 2 tbsp yogurt.
Make round balls filled with stuffing, deep fry balls and keep aside.

recipes.name: Ghutwa Kebab
instructions: Marinate mince with onion, raw papaya paste, bread slice, ginger garlic paste, roasted gram flour, garam masala, salt, mace and nutmeg, red pepper, coriander, mix all well and leave it for 1 hour.
Heat oil in a pan, fry onion till light golden.
Now add it into marinated mince and fry for 15 minutes till its colour turn into brown.
Garnish with chillies, coriander leaves, onion rings and serve hot.

recipes.name: Iskender Kebabs
ingredients: Ground cumin & Black Pepper to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Stir in chicken till juices run clear.
Mix in tomato puree and season with cumin, salt and pepper.
Continue cooking for 10 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Arrange pita bread on a baking try and lightly toast in the oven.
Cut it into bite size pieces and set aside. Keep warm.
Arrange pita pieces in a serving dish, drizzle with butter, and top with the chicken mixture.
Garnish with yoghurt and parsley and serve.

recipes.name: Chapli Kebab
instructions: In a bowl mix together mince, gram flour, crushed coriander, pomegranate seeds, crushed red pepper, garam masala powder and salt.
Finely chop tomatoes, onion, green chilies and coriander leaves.
Add vegetables in the mince mixture.
Then add egg and butter. Mix very well.
Form large patties with the mince mixture.
Then fry in a large griddle until golden brown.

recipes.name: Daal Kebab
instructions: Wash soak and boil both lentils separately.
Mix together until lentils and chicken mince well blended.
Add in rice flour, eggs, green coriander, green chilies, mint leaves, cumin, red chili flakes, black pepper and some salt.
Make kabab and shallow fry them until they are golden fry.
Serve them chili garlic sauce.

recipes.name: Reshmi Kebab
instructions: Marinate chicken mince with clarified butter, almonds, coconut milk powder, garam masala powder, cumin, salt, red pepper, white pepper, coriander, green chili, ginger garlic paste and cream, mix well.
Shape kabab on broad square skewers.
BBQ over hot charcoal

recipes.name: Galawat Ke Kebab
instructions: Take mince beef in a mixing bowl and add raw papaya, red chilli powder, garam masala powder, fresh cream, chopped mint, green chilli, onion chopped and salt.
Mix well and keep aside for Overnight.
Now make small patties from the meat mixture and shallow fry it on low flame.
Then dish out and serve it with paratha and mint chutney.

recipes.name: Potato Cutlets
instructions: Peel and boil the potatoes.
Add in salt, red chili powder, ginger garlic paste, chili flakes, lemon juice, cumin, black pepper, sesame seed, green chili and coriander leaves and mix well.
Then refrigerate this mixture for 15 - 20 minutes.
Now make small cutlets of potato mixture and dip in lightly beat egg.
Fry the potato cutlets in a frying pan on medium flame till golden brown.
Potato cutlets are ready to serve.

recipes.name: Kakori Kebabs
instructions: Mince lamb twice and a third time with the oil.
Blend all the other ingredients (except saffron, red chilli powder and vetivier) together and mix with the mince.
Add red chilli powder, saffron and vetivier. Knead well.
Set aside for half an hour. Knead again.
Pat the mixture in a thin layer around the skewers and cook over low charcoal fire for 5 minutes.
Baste with butter and cook again for 4 minutes.
Transfer to an oven at 325 ºF for 8 minutes.
Baste with butter and roast again for 4 minutes.
Serve hot with sheermal.

recipes.name: Seekh Kebab
instructions: Mix mince with all other ingredients.
Knead well for 10 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes.
Moisten hands with cold water and mold mixture around skewers pressing and shaping to the size of a frankfurter sausage, about 5, 1/2 inch long.
Roast the kebabs in a moderately hot clay oven (tandoor) for 12 minutes till they are browned uniformly.
The kebabs can also be slid off the skewers and cooked on the fine wire mesh of the grilling rack in a charcoal gas grill.
Do not turn too often as the kebabs may split.
Serve hot with mint chutney.

recipes.name: Fish Kebab
instructions: Wash and soak gram lentils for 15 minutes.
Cook with cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds and garlic until 3/4 tender.
Drain and keep its water for boiling the fish.
Boil the fish in the same water until tender and water is absorbed.
Cool, remove the bones and skin.
Then grind with gram lentils.
Grind onion, green chillies, ginger and coriander leaves finely.
Mix into ground mixture of fish and lentils.
Mix in egg yolks.
Then shape it in small round balls.
Deep fry in oil until nicely golden.
Drain on absorbent paper, insert toothpick in each kebab.
Serve hot with chutneys.

recipes.name: Macaroni Cutlets
instructions: Mash the boiled potatoes.
Now take a mixing bowl; mix potatoes and macaroni.
Then add the black pepper powder, white cumin powder, chopped green onions, Chinese salt and salt.
Shape into cutlets oval shape or lengthwise.
Dip into beaten eggs and coat with breadcrumbs.
Deep fry and serve with ketchup.

recipes.name: Malai Kebabs
instructions: Mix all the marination ingredients in mince and marinate for 2 hours.
Make oval or round shaped kebabs.
Heat oil on medium heat fry kebabs till brown.
Beat cream, cheese and black pepper.
Serve kebabs with cream topping and mashed potatoes.

recipes.name: Jalfrezi Kebabs
ingredients: Boneless chicken thighs 2 lbs (cut into bite size pieces)
instructions: Marinade chicken with oil, lemon juice, salt, pepper, corriander and cumin powder for at least fifteen minutes to half an hour.
Saute chicken in a large pot on high heat so meat doesn't give off the juices and rather fries.
Continue to fry while stirring until chicken is completely cooked.
Chop bell peppers and onion into chunky cubes and stir into cooked meat.
Cook for 2-3 minutes on high heat to keep the vegetables firm and crisp.
Remove and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Potato Cutlets (Version 2)
instructions: Blend all the chutney ingredients into a fine paste.
Boil and mash the potatoes. Add salt, cheese, white pepper, black pepper, bread slices and green chutney.
Mix well. Make cutlets and refrigerate for 15 minutes.
Dip the cutlets in beaten eggs, toss them in bread crumbs and refrigerate again for 10-15 minutes.
In a wok or frying pan, heat the cooking oil on medium heat for 3-5 minutes and fry the cutlets till golden.
Serve hot with tomato ketchup.

recipes.name: Kebabs Mughlai Style
instructions: Grind the ginger, garlic, cumin seed, chilies and coriander to a fine paste.
Add the salt to taste.
Cut meat into desired cubes and rub this paste over it.
Marinate for 2 1/2 hours.
Fix the meat cubes on skewers, placing an onion between each cube of meat.
Grill on a low fire till tender and browned.
In a saucepan heat the ghee, add milk, cream, finely grated almonds and pistachios.
Mix well and cook till slightly thickened.
Garnish with ground cardamoms and serve with the kebabs.

recipes.name: Mooli ke Kebab
instructions: Cut off the base and leaves from the radishes.
Prick them with a fork and boil in salted water for 20 minutes until nearly tender.
Drain well and grind roughly. Now grind all the spices and coconut to a fine paste and mix with the gram flour, curd, powdered saffron and salt to taste.
In a little ghee, fry the onions till golden brown and crisp.
Drain well, grind to a paste and mix with the rest of the ingredients.
Take a little mixture and form into round kebabs.
Put breadcrumbs evenly on both sides and shallow fry in ghee until golden brown. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Paneer Cutlets
instructions: Mix the paneer, potatoes, breadcrumbs, pepper and salt.
Mash well. For the filling, mix the Peas, lemon juice and chilli paste and mash it in a blender. Keep aside.
Make equal-sized balls out of the potato-paneer mixture.
Flatten each ball into a thin cutlet and spoon a little of the filling into its centre.
Cover with another cutlet. Seal the edges and shallow fry in the oil.
Grease a baking dish. Arrange the cutlets on it.
Pour the pizza sauce over the cutlets.
Sprinkle the cheese on the sauce and bake at 200°C for 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Prawn kebab
ingredients: Cooked prawns (mashed to a paste) 1 cup
instructions: Slice the chilies, coriander and garlic very fine.
Mix all the ingredients add salt to taste, and form into flat cutlets.
Dip in beaten eggs, roll in breadcrumbs and fry.

recipes.name: Dhal Kebabs
instructions: Wash and soak the moong dhal overnight.
Drain water and grind to a fine paste.
Fry finely sliced onion until crisp and brown.
Remove, grind coarsely and keep aside.
In the same ghee, fry gram flour and garam masala for a minute.
Mix ground dhal gram flour mixture, beaten eggs, curd finely chopped chilies, fried onion and salt until well blended.
Form into flat cutlets, roll in breadcrumbs and fry in ghee until evenly browned.

recipes.name: Egg Cutlets
instructions: Melt butter in a saucepan.
Add flour and cook, stirring constantly, for a few seconds.
Add milk, stir well and boil for 5 minutes.
Add rice, chopped eggs, chopped green chilies, nutmeg, parsley and breadcrumbs. Mix well.
Spread on a floured platter and let cool.
Then divide into equal portions and shape into cutlets.
Coat in egg and breadcrumbs and deep fry in hot fat.
Drain well on kitchen paper and serve with tomato puree or chutney.

recipes.name: Hara Kebab
ingredients: Spinach 1kg, stems removed and thoroughly cleaned
Yellow lentils (Bengal gram) 30gms, picked through for debris and rinsed in cold water
Green Thai chili pepper 1 tablespoon finely chopped
instructions: Have ready a large rimmed baking sheet.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, wilt the spinach; it will take only about 30 seconds. Drain the spinach, rinse it with cold water until it has cooled, and squeeze out as much water as possible. Transfer to a food processor and pulse until it forms a dense, pesto-like paste. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

In a large pot of boiling salted water over high heat, cook the yellow lentils for about 25 minutes, until they have softened. Drain and rinse with cold water until the lentils have cooled. Transfer to a food processor and pulse to form a paste. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
In a small skillet over medium-high heat, toast the cumin seeds for about 30 seconds. Let them cool slightly, then transfer to a grinder and grind the seeds into a fine powder.

In a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, heat 2 tablespoons of the oil until it is smoking. Add the yellow lentil paste and cook for 5 to 7 minutes, stirring constantly, until it becomes dry. Add the spinach paste and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring, until the mixture appears dry. Add the ginger, green chili pepper, garam masala, ground cumin seeds and salt. Spread the mixture onto the baking sheet to cool completely.
At this point, the mixture can be refrigerated.
When ready to cook, line a plate with paper towels. Divide the mixture into equal portions and form into patties 2 1/2 inches in diameter.
The mixture for the kebab can be made up to 2 days in advance and refrigerated. Serve these kebab with Mint Chutney.

recipes.name: Seasoned Fish Kebabs
ingredients: Firm-fleshed fish steaks 1kg, skin removed and cubed
Onions 3 medium-size, 1 very finely chopped and 2 quartered and layers separated
Green bell pepper 1, seeded and cut into 20 to 24 square pieces
Bay leaves 18, soaked in tepid water to cover for 30 minutes (no need to soak if using fresh)
Freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, 1 chopped onion, cumin, salt and pepper in a large ceramic or glass baking dish and marinate the fish cubes for 4 to 6 hours, covered, in the refrigerator, turning occasionally.
Skewer the fish, putting a piece of quartered onion and a piece of green pepper between the pieces of fish and using 2 to 3 bay leaves per skewer.
Continue in this manner until all the ingredients are skewered.
Prepare a charcoal fire or preheat a gas grill on high for 20 minutes.
Grill the skewered fish for 10 to 12 minutes brushing with the marinade and turning once.
Serve garnished with lemon wedges and parsley.

recipes.name: Gingery Fish Kebabs
ingredients: Fresh pineapple in large chunks 4 cups
Red onion 1 large, cut in wedges
instructions: In a small saucepan, dissolve cornstarch in pineapple juice.
Add soya sauce, vinegar, garlic and ginger.
Simmer until slightly thickened, about 7 minutes. Let cool.
Add fish and pineapple to sauce and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
Thread fish, pineapple and onion on skewers.
Place on a hot grill (or under a broiler) until fish is done to your liking.
Serve with rice.
Heat marinade and use as a sauce over fish and rice.

recipes.name: Rajma Galoti Kebabs
ingredients: Sunflower seeds 2 tbsps (for roasting and grinding)
Poppy seeds (khus khus) 1 1/2 tbsps (for roasting and grinding)
Fresh mint leaves and onion rings (for garnishing)
instructions: Blend cooked rajma in a blender. Add green chilles, roasted spice powder, salt, ginger blend again.
Add cashewnut, sunflower seeds, khuskhus powder and continue to blend. Transfer the mixture into a bowl.
Add a little kewra water and mix. Divide the mixture into sixteen equal portions.
Roll each portion into a ball and press a little. Roll the edges against a flat surface to even the edges.
Heat ghee on a tawa and Fry on medium heat till well browned.
Drain and serve hot garnished with onion rings and fresh mint leaves.

recipes.name: Chicken and Vegetable Kebabs
instructions: Wash and peel the vegetables.
Boil potatoes separately and mash.
Dice rest of the vegetables finely and boil.
Add to mashed potatoes and mix in chicken mince.
Add chopped onions, grated ginger, green chilies, lemon juice with all the given spices and 1/2 cup breadcrumbs.
Mix well and pat flat on a board sprinkled with corn flour and cut in desired shapes with biscuit cutter.
Pat breadcrumbs on both sides and fry in hot oil.
Serve with tomato chutney, green chutney, salad and bread rolls.

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Chilli Fry
instructions: Marinate chicken strips with salt, chilli powder, black pepper powder, ginger garlic paste, roasted and crushed cumin, yogurt, lemon juice, pinch of orange colour, leave it for 15 minutes.
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan fry marinated chicken, now put a burning coal in pan, drop some oil and cover for 1 minute.
Method for Gravy: Heat butter in a fry pan, add onion, tomato and capsicum, stir fry for 2 minutes.
Add sliced ginger, green chillies, crushed black pepper and red pepper add cooked chicken with lemon juice.
Now lastly add coriander leaves and remove from stove. Serve hot with naan.

recipes.name: Barbecued BBQ Liver Boti
instructions: Rub ginger, garlic, and onion pastes on the liver cubes and set aside for an hour.
Mix the remaining ingredients (except oil / butter for basting) with the yoghurt and coat the liver cubes.
Leave to marinate for at least 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 150°C (300°F).
Thread the cubes gently onto the skewers.
Roast / grill / bake till half done (10 minutes).
Drain the excess marinade, baste once and roast again for 4 - 5 minutes till cooked through.
Serve at once, accompanied by salad.

recipes.name: Pine Nuts Chicken Kebabs
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine the ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, pine nuts, lemon juice, dried fengreek leaves, paprika and salt. Mix well.
Add the chicken cubes, stir to coat, cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Add the yogurt and mix again. Refrigerate for 8 hours.
When ready to cook the kebabs, prepare the grill. If using a gas grill, preheat the grill on medium.
If using a charcoal grill, start the charcoal.
Clean the grate with a grill brush.
Thread the coated chicken cubes onto the skewers.
Grill for about 15 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and its juices run clear.

recipes.name: Muthi Kebabs
instructions: Mix all the ingredients, except butter and keep aside for two hours.
Put the mixture in a pan and make a well in the centre.
Place a smoking piece of charcoal in a small bowl of butter and place it in the well and cover the pan with a tight lid.
Leave for three minutes then discard the charcoal piece.
Make oblong kebabs by taking small portions of the mixture.
Bake them in a preheated oven till golden brown.

recipes.name: Dum ke Kabab
ingredients: Mutton 1 kg, boneless cut in pieces
instructions: Wash and clean meat, spread it out on a board.
With the blunt side of a heavy knife pound lightly.
Mix all ingredients except oil, with yogurt and lemon and marinate the meat in it for 4-6 hours.
Heat oil, add meat and cook on low heat. Remove when meat is tender and liquid has evaporated; spread it out in a large shallow steel pan, pour a tbsp of ghee and cover it.
Put a tawa on low heat, put the covered pan on it and place a few hot coals on the lid.
Leave for 10-15 minutes. Serve with hot parathas.

recipes.name: Bread and Mince Meat Kebabs
instructions: Soak the bread slices in the mixture of Soya sauce and vinegar for 10 minutes.
Mix it with the mincemeat.
Now add black pepper, fresh coriander and the beaten egg.
Mix well, knead this mixture with your hands for a few minutes and leave for an hour.
Take small portions from the meat mixture and shape to form kebabs and fry.

recipes.name: Barah Kebabs
instructions: Marinade the lamb in salt, red chilli powder, garam masala, malt vinegar, ginger and garlic pastes, papaya paste, kachri and cumin seeds overnight.
Skewer pieces 1 inch apart and roast on a slow fire in a tandoor or charcoal grill for 15 minutes or till half done.
Stand at room temperature for 20 minutes. Baste with oil.
Roast or grill on slow fire for another 20 minutes, till velvety brown.
Serve with onion rings, fresh green salad and lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Badami Lamb Shammi Kebab
instructions: Boil the minced lamb with Bengal gram, dry red chillies, green chillies, & all spices till the water evaporates.
Remove the whole spices from the mince & discard.
Mash the mince well.
Add eggs and salt and knead well. Mix in the almonds.
Divide the mixture into even-sized balls and shape into cutlets.
Heat the oil in a wok (kadhai), deep-fry the cutlets until crisp and brown on all sides.
Remove and drain the excess oil & serve hot.

recipes.name: Turkish Kebabs
ingredients: Oil to brush the grill pan
instructions: Cut the lamb into cubes not more than 1 1/2 inches.
To make the marinade in a bowl finely grate the lemon rind into a bowl,
Now add the finely chopped onion, garlic, bay leaves, cayenne pepper, chopped up fresh thyme and mint along with the olive oil and mix well well.
Season with salt and pepper.
Now add the lamb cubes to this marinade and mix well and coat it fully and leave in the fridge overnight.
Thread the lamb onto skewers spacing them slightly apart. preheat oven to 180 C.
Heat a grill pan and brush with oil.
When at smoking point at the kebabs and cook till u get some grill lines and charred bits on the meat.
Now place the skewers in a baking tray and place in the oven to cook for a further 8 minutes or until the meat is tender and just cooked, serve hot!
You could barbeque them on a charcoal grill for that lovely smoky flavor.

recipes.name: Spanish Kebabs
ingredients: Mutton Boneless cut into cubes 300 gm
instructions: Chop the parsley, crush the garlic clove along with the pink and black peppercorns.
In a glass bowl combine the cumin, cayenne pepper, paprika, salt, lemon juice and oil along with the crushed garlic and peppercorns.
Add parsley. Mix well together.
Add the meat cubes and coat well with the marinade.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
Soak 4 wooden skewers in cold water for 15 minutes.
Now thread the pieces of meat on the skewer.
Reserve the marinade.
Grill on a charcoal grill or a grill pan basting the kebabs with the marinade occasionally until cooked.

recipes.name: Iranian Chelo Kebab
instructions: Marinate mince with ground onions, ginger paste, salt, black pepper, butter and soda bicarb. Leave for 30 minutes.
Then shape into long seekh kabab.
Now grill for 10 minutes. Lower a piece of burning charcoal and add a few drops of oil over it; cover immediately.
Serve with rice.

recipes.name: Afghani Kebab with Tomato Gravy
instructions: Add ginger garlic Paste, onions, 1/2 tea spoon black pepper and salt to mincemeat and knead well.
Make oblong shaped kebabs and refrigerate for 10-15 minutes.
In a wok or a frying pan, heat Oil on medium heat for 3-4 minutes and fry the kebabs till golden.
In a pot, slightly heat Oil on medium heat for 3-4 minutes.
Add tomatoes, salt and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper and stir for 3-4 minutes.
Then spread the kebabs in the pot.
Simmer on low heat for 5-7 minutes and remove from stove.
Garnish and serve hot with rooghni naan or boiled rice.

recipes.name: Kashmiri Kabab Curry
instructions: Mix the mince meat, split gram, whole spices, a cup of water and salt to taste in a pan.
Cook until liquid dries.
Remove from the heat and add ginger, garlic, pepper, chilli powder, coriander and cumin powder garam masala powder, and grind the mixture into a fine paste and knead into a dough.
Now add the chopped mint leaves, lime juice, onion and salt to taste.
Make lemon sized balls of the dough, flatten the balls and stuff them with a little onion mixture.
Dip the stuffed kebabs in the beaten eggs and shallow fry till golden brown

recipes.name: Malai Tikka
instructions: Marinate chicken with all the ingredients and take a little mixture and skew on the skewers so that the tikkas do not break off in places.
Barbeque and serve hot.
